availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Ignatius C. Mattingly and Mary E. Mattingly. Married to Sallie Roane Tharp Mattingly in Nelson County on October 27, 1853. Father of Sarah Mattingly, Ignatius Clark Mattingly, and Fayette Roan Mattingly. Stepfather of T. Tharp. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Household owned twelve slaves in Nelson County in 1860. Clerk in Nelson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 184.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 119A and 107A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 459.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058: Nelson County Births, 1854, p. 1.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058: Nelson County Deaths, 1858, p. 3.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 4th Congressional District, Vol. 2, 1863, p. 345, p. 48 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on April 15, 2020).
